description:
Fedora and CentOS are among the most used GNU/Linux distribution and completely built using free and open source software. However they address different use cases. Participating in these presentation will enable a person to understand how software are getting developed, derived through the operating system and the complete life cycle of it. It will also help to understand the real world issues these software projects are trying to solve and current advancements in these areas. This talk we will talk about these communities, possible areas of contribution, some communication guidelines and will try to answer the most frequently asked question i.e. how do I find out an open source project to contribute 

Links:
http://nosconf.github.io/
title: Linux Distro: Fedora and CentOS
